intro: Coccoloba yaracuyensis, commonly known as the Yaracuyensis lacandon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically lobed and have a glossy appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
